body_html:
@saikishor I believe both Azure and AWS offer 10/25 Gbps accelerated network for their VMs. You could give that a shot. After all, 10 Gbps Ethernet should be pretty affordable in 2018 :)

I am running distributed object detection with TF 1.8 and on servers with 2X10Gbps network. With 9 GPU on each machine, I got 0.2 sec/step in single machine mode and 0.6 sec /step in 2 worker mode. Tried increasing number of PS servers but seems no difference. During training, I observed around 700MB/s network traffic on both machine. Is this expected?

I am running distributed object detection with TF 1.8 and on servers with 2X10Gbps network. With 9 GPU on each machine, I got 0.2 sec/step in single machine mode and 0.6 sec /step in 2 worker mode. Tried increasing number of PS servers but seems no difference. During training, I observed around 700MB/s network traffic on both machine. Is this expected?
